data.chText: 挑战；艰巨任务
data.enText: a new or difficult task that tests sb's ability and skill

data.chText: 令人激动的 / 令人感兴趣的挑战
data.enText: an exciting/interesting challenge

data.chText: 扮演这个角色将是他演艺生涯中最大的挑战。
data.enText: The role will be the biggest challenge of his acting career.

data.chText: 面临挑战
data.enText: to face a challenge (= to have to deal with one)

data.chText: 环境的破坏是我们所面临的最严峻的挑战之一。
data.enText: Destruction of the environment is one of the most serious challenges we face.

data.chText: 学校必须迎接新技术的挑战。
data.enText: Schools must meet the challenge of new technology (= deal with it successfully) .

data.chText: 挑战书；（比赛等的）邀请，提议
data.enText: an invitation or a suggestion to sb that they should enter a competition, fight, etc.

data.chText: 接受挑战
data.enText: to accept/take up a challenge

data.chText: 发起挑战
data.enText: to mount a challenge

data.chText: 质询；质疑；提出异议
data.enText: a statement or an action that shows that sb refuses to accept sth and questions whether it is right, legal, etc.

data.chText: 这是对主席权威的直接质疑。
data.enText: It was a direct challenge to the president's authority.

data.chText: 他们的法律质疑未获成功。
data.enText: Their legal challenge was unsuccessful.

data.chText: 对…怀疑（或质疑）；拒绝接受
data.enText: to question whether a statement or an action is right, legal, etc.; to refuse to accept sth

data.chText: 此案情纯属捏造，已在法庭上被揭穿。
data.enText: The story was completely untrue and was successfully challenged in court.

data.chText: 她不喜欢任何人挑战她的权威。
data.enText: She does not like anyone challenging her authority.

data.chText: 这项发现是对传统信念的冲击。
data.enText: This discovery challenges traditional beliefs.

data.chText: 向（某人）挑战；（尤指在对方不情愿时）强烈建议（某人做某事）
data.enText: to invite sb to enter a competition, fight, etc.; to suggest strongly that sb should do sth (especially when you think that they might be unwilling to do it)

data.chText: 迈克硬逼着要和我下一盘棋。
data.enText: Mike challenged me to a game of chess.

data.chText: 反对党领袖要求首相宣布进行大选。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: The opposition leader challenged the prime minister to call an election.

data.chText: 考查…的能力；考验…的技巧
data.enText: to test sb's ability and skills, especially in an interesting way

data.chText: 这项工作不能真正考验出她的能力。
data.enText: The job doesn't really challenge her.

data.chText: 盘问；查问
data.enText: to order sb to stop and say who they are or what they are doing

data.chText: 我们在边境受到警察盘问。
data.enText: We were challenged by police at the border.

means: (尤指在对方不情愿时)强烈建议(某人做某事)

tr: a demand by a sentry for a password or identification
questioning a statement and demanding an explanation
example: his challenge of the assumption that Japan is still our enemy

tr: a formal objection to the selection of a particular person as a juror
a call to engage in a contest or fight

example: they reacted irrationally to the challenge of Russian power

tr: raise a formal objection in a court of law

example: The illegal immigrant was challenged by the border guard
Fischer challenged Spassky to a match

value.def: A challenge is something new and difficult which requires great effort and determination.

example.ex: I like a big challenge and they don't come much bigger than this...
example.tran: 我喜欢大的挑战，而所有挑战中再没有比这更大的了。

example.ex: The new government's first challenge is the economy.
example.tran: 新政府面临的第一个难题是经济问题。

value.def: If someone rises to the challenge, they act in response to a difficult situation which is new to them and are successful.

example.ex: The new Germany must rise to the challenge of its enhanced responsibilities...
example.tran: 一个崭新的德国必须迎接挑战，承担更多的责任。

example.ex: They rose to the challenge of entertaining 80 schoolchildren for an afternoon.
example.tran: 他们一个下午成功接待了80名学童。

value.def: A challenge to something is a questioning of its truth or value. A challenge to someone is a questioning of their authority.

example.ex: The demonstrators have now made a direct challenge to the authority of the government.
example.tran: 示威者现在直接对政府的权威发出了质疑。

value.tran: (对真实性、价值、权威等提出的)怀疑，质疑

value.def: If you challenge ideas or people, you question their truth, value, or authority.

example.ex: Democratic leaders have challenged the president to sign the bill...
example.tran: 民主党领袖对总统签署这项法案提出了质疑。

example.ex: The move was immediately challenged by two of the republics...
example.tran: 此项动议立即遭到其中两个共和国的反对。

example.ex: I challenged him on the hypocrisy of his political attitudes.
example.tran: 我就他虚伪的政治观点质问他。

gramarinfo.label: Also V with quote, V n

value.tran: 怀疑，质疑(真实性、价值、权威等)

value.def: If you challenge someone, you invite them to fight or compete with you in some way.

example.ex: A mum slashed a neighbour's car tyre and challenged her to a fight after their daughters fell out...
example.tran: 两家的女儿吵起来后，一个妈妈划破了邻居的车胎，说要和她较量较量。

example.ex: He left a note at the scene of the crime, challenging detectives to catch him...
example.tran: 他在犯罪现场留了个条儿，向警探挑衅。

example.ex: We challenged a team who called themselves 'College Athletes'.
example.tran: 我们向一个自称“大学运动员”的队下了战书。

example.ex: A third presidential candidate emerged to mount a serious challenge and throw the campaign wide open.
example.tran: 第三位总统候选人的杀出对前两位构成了严峻挑战，并使得选举形势扑朔迷离。

value.def: If someone is challenged by a guard, they are ordered to stop and say who they are or why they are there.

example.ex: The men apparently opened fire after they were challenged by a patrol.
example.tran: 显然，那些人是在受到一支巡逻队的盘问后开的火。

trans: 挑战杯；优胜杯；欧洲挑战杯
